googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationDirections:
1. New Hampshire strongly prefers that you register to vote in person.
2. If you cannot register to vote in person, call your [town or city clerk](https://www.voteamerica.com/local-election-offices/NH/) and ask them to mail you a New Hampshire Voter Registration Form. **This form is not available online.**
3. Once you get the New Hampshire voter registration form, fill it out completely and send it back to the address on the form.
4. If you have any questions, please contact your [town or city clerk](https://www.voteamerica.com/local-election-offices/NH/).
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr:
To register, you will need to provide proof of your identity, age, citizenship, and address. Proof can be either by documents or if you do not have documents with you, by affidavit. Documents may be presented in paper or electronic form. 

* A driver’s license or non-driver ID from any state satisfies proof of identity and age.
* A birth certificate, U.S. Passport/Passcard, or naturalization document satisfies proof of citizenship. 


If you do not have these, you can prove your identity, age, and/or citizenship, by signing a Qualified Voter Affidavit, under oath, in front of an election official.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* You will need an excuse to vote by mail in New Hampshire, but 100% of voters can use COVID-19 as an excuse. 
* If you request an absentee ballot due to COVID-19, you must select "I am unable to vote in person due to concern for the novel coronavirus (COVID-19)." on the absentee request form.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
New Hampshire Secretary of State’s Office  
Elections Division  
State House, Room 204  
107 North Main Street  
Concord, NH 03301
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All New Hampshire voters must show a photo ID issued by any US state or the federal government.  If you are under 65 years old, your ID cannot be expired.  If you are over 65, an expired ID is fine.  Acceptable forms of ID include a driver's license from any state; a nondriver's ID from any state; a US passport; a US military ID; or an employee ID issued by any government agency.  You can also show a student ID card issued by a NH college or university.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: New Hampshire voters generally need to provide an excuse to vote by mail. For 2020 only, any New Hampshire resident can use COVID-19 concerns as a reason for voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: New Hampshire voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in New Hampshire you must:

  * Be a citizen of the United States
  * Be 18 years of age or older on Election Day
  * Register to vote only in the town or ward in which you actually live
  * Not have been convicted of a felony, unless you are past your final discharge
  * Not have been ever convicted of bribery or intimidation relating to elections
